patient_summary: The patient is a 44-year-old African-American male who was diagnosed with end-stage renal disease requiring hemodialysis, congestive heart failure, and hypertension. He has been feeling lightheaded and has had syncopal episodes. He was admitted for likely orthostatic hypotension and was given medications to manage his blood pressure and heart failure. He was reluctant to proceed with a nuclear medicine stress test. The patient left AMA and did not receive any specific discharge instructions or medications.

missing_info.why_required: To ensure the patient's ongoing care and management of their conditions.
To ensure the patient's safety and well-being at home.
To ensure the patient is taking the correct medications and dosages.

notes: The patient left AMA. No specific discharge instructions and medications were given. The patient's medications were as follows: Aspirin 81 mg p.o. daily, Multivitamin, Fosrenol 500 mg chewable t.i.d, Lisinopril 2.5 mg daily, Coreg 3.125 mg p.o. b.i.d, Procrit 10,000 units inject every Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday, Heparin 5000 units q.8h. subcutaneous for DVT prophylaxis.
